title: Ptolemy's Theorem
description: For a cyclic quadrilateral, the product of diagonals equals the sum of products of opposite sides: AC·BD = AB·CD + BC·DA

meta.author: Ptolemy of Alexandria (formalized in Lean 4 with Mathlib)

overview.historicalContext: Ptolemy proved this in the Almagest (c. 150 AD) to compute chord tables for astronomy. It was fundamental to trigonometry before modern notation.
overview.problemStatement:
**Ptolemy's Theorem**:

For a cyclic quadrilateral ABCD (inscribed in a circle):

$$|AC| \cdot |BD| = |AB| \cdot |CD| + |BC| \cdot |DA|$$

The product of the diagonals equals the sum of the products of opposite sides.
overview.proofStrategy: Use Mathlib's cospherical point framework with angle conditions at the diagonal intersection.

conclusion.summary: Ptolemy's theorem is verified using Mathlib's Euclidean geometry library for cospherical points.
